channel.title: BBC News - World
channel.description: The latest stories from the World section of the BBC News web site.
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Kerala temple fire leaves 100 dead
item.description: The death toll rises to more than 100 after fireworks sparked a blaze at Puttingal temple in the Indian state of Kerala, police say.

item.title: Suspect 'says he is Brussels man in hat'
item.description: Belgian prosecutors say a suspect has admitted being the "man in the hat" seen with the suicide bombers who attacked a Brussels airport.

item.title: PM releases tax returns data amid row
item.description: David Cameron reveals his earnings and taxes in an unprecedented move by a UK prime minister, after his father was mentioned in the leaked Panama Papers.

item.title: Philippines clash kills 18 soldiers
item.description: The Philippines military says 18 soldiers have been killed in fierce fighting with Islamist militants in the south of the country.

item.title: Bernie Sanders wins Wyoming contest
item.description: Bernie Sanders wins the latest stage in the battle for the Democratic nomination in the US presidential election by securing victory in Wyoming.

item.title: US Navy rescues sailors from island
item.description: Three sailors are rescued from an uninhabited Pacific island by the US Navy after spelling out "help" with palm fronds.

item.title: Three dead in attack ahead of Peru poll
item.description: Suspected leftist rebels in Peru have killed three people in an attack ahead of Sunday's presidential election, the military says

item.title: 'No end date' for Kabul power-sharing
item.description: There is no fixed date for an end to the power-sharing deal between rival Afghan leaders, says US Secretary of State John Kerry during a visit to Kabul.

item.title: Egypt denies Italian request in probe
item.description: Egypt rejects Italy's request for phone records relating to the death of Italian student Giulio Regeni in Cairo earlier this year.

item.title: 'First migrant deaths' since Turkey deal
item.description: Four women and a child die in the Aegean Sea in what are thought to be the first deaths in the area since a new operation to deter migrants began.

item.title: US issues warning over Turkey travel
item.description: The US warns its citizens of "credible threats" to tourist areas in Turkey, particularly in Istanbul and the resort city of Antalya.

item.title: Yemen soldiers 'killed in ambush'
item.description: At least 15 soldiers loyal to Yemen's government are reportedly ambushed and killed, with al-Qaeda denying official claims that it was responsible.

item.title: Man rescued from cliff after proposing
item.description: A US man's romantic marriage proposal from a steep cliff face in California hits the rocks after he gets stuck and has to be rescued.

item.title: Romania sells ex-dictator's luxuries
item.description: Romania sells off more luxuries from the vast collection of communist dictator Nicolae Ceausescu and his wife, executed in 1989.

item.title: VIDEO: 'He just disappeared and joined IS'
item.description: A relative of one of the Brussels bombing suspects says her nephew "just disappeared" and later told his family that he had left to join the so-called Islamic State.

item.title: VIDEO: Video shows Belgium suspect arrest
item.description: Amateur video shows the moment a terror suspect, believed to be Mohamed Abrini, was arrested in Brussels on Friday.

item.title: VIDEO: Bus plunges into river in Peru
item.description: At least 23 people have been killed and 32 injured after a bus plunged into a river in south-eastern Peru.

item.title: VIDEO: Recreating prisoners' epic escape
item.description: A photographer has recreated the 1,400-mile journey his grandfather and great uncle took after they escaped from a prisoner-of-war camp in 1945.

item.title: VIDEO: Boy sealed in lorry rescued by texting
item.description: A seven-year-old boy from Afghanistan was rescued from a sealed lorry on a British motorway after texting someone in the US for help.

item.title: VIDEO: 'I didn't know if he was going to kill me'
item.description: Alicia Kozakiewicz was 13 years old when she was kidnapped by a man she had met online- she told Victoria Derbyshire presenter Joanna Gosling her story.

item.title: VIDEO: Myanmar prisoners to be released
item.description: Dozens of students in Myanmar who have been awaiting trial have been set free as the new government begins to release all remaining political prisoners.

item.title: VIDEO: US firm sets 'mattress dominoes' record
item.description: More than 1,000 workers and mattresses set a new world record for "largest human mattress dominoes", according to Guinness World Records.

item.title: The black people 'erased from history'
item.description: The black people afraid their past is being erased

item.title: Missing in Chile: What happened to Boris Weisfeiler?
item.description: Searching for a US hiker who went missing three decades ago

item.title: The Indian woman who hunts the witch hunters
item.description: The Indian woman who hunts witch hunters

item.title: The end of the Spanish siesta?
item.description: Why Spain no longer wants an afternoon nap

item.title: Sudan's Bashir in defiant form on tour of Darfur region
item.description: Sudan's president tours Darfur ahead of vote

item.title: Quirky Pakistan crooner unlikely sensation
item.description: Pakistan's unlikely internet star, Taher Shah
